results.title: The Gentleman in room 6
results.creator_credit: Alexander Hammid, George K. Arthur and Meteor Films
results.brief_description: Short story film about a derelict and forgotten character hiding in a room womewhere in South America. he is confronted by three of his old associates, each of whom provides further clues to his identity which is revealed in the last few seconds of the film.

results.title: Gentle strangers
results.brief_description: A drama concerning a Thai girl who comes to Australia to study. Provides an insight into some of the problems faced by Asian students in our country.

results.title: The Gentle art of film projection
results.creator_credit: Donald Peters, Michael Spencer and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Some pointers on the art of film projection, told through the humorous story of a poor showman who lost his film audience because he didn’t know how to operate a 16mm projector. The moment that George Beesley appears on the scene we know something ridiculous is bound to happen—and it does! This sad sack merrily muddles through the film showing and annoys his audience so thoroughly that they walk out in disgust. An interested spectator then patiently explains the principles of efficient projection, while animated sequences demonstrate the construction of a projector, the preparation in advance of the room to be used for the showing, and the correct placement of screen and loudspeaker. Procedures for preventing damage to film and equipment are outlined. Animation by Wolf Koenig.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Donald Peters, Michael Spencer and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Genetics and plant breeding
results.creator_credit: David Morphet, Peter Bradford, Unilever Films and World Wide Pictures
results.brief_description: Mendel’s laws of inheritance, and how the passage of the dominant and recessive characteristics from one generation to another depends on discrete particles of matter, particles which are now known to be genes on the chromosomes in the cell nucleus. It shows how the principles of genetics are applied to produce new varieties of plants.

results.title: Generators of hope: the flags are not enough
results.creator_credit: Stephen Hearst and United Nations Television
results.brief_description: Defines poverty in terms of “power” and “energy” and tells of the critical gulf between the huge hydroelectrical projects of rich countries and the use of human and animal power in the poor lands. Discusses new possibilities in using energy sources to turn the wheels and light the homes in less-developed lands. Narrated by Alistair Cooke.

results.title: Generation of electricity
results.brief_description: Opens with a survey of the uses of electricity in everyday life. A simple laboratory experiment with magnet, solenoid and galvanometer is used to demonstrate the principles of electricity generation. Diagrams explain the operations of rotating coil and rotating magnet types of generators. The latter part of the film shows how water power is used to turn the turbines of generators used in power stations.

results.title: General wharf safety
results.creator_credit: New Zealand. Marine Dept and New Zealand National Film Unit
results.brief_description: The simple precautions that can save serious accidents on the waterfront. Watching wharf traffic; using gangways and not planks; keeping hatch covers, gear and dunnage stacked neatly out of the way; walking on the off side of an overhead crane; reporting damage promptly; working in good light; keeping guard rails and ropes around open hatches and holds.

results.title: The General foreman
results.creator_credit: Morten Parker and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Nature of Work”.
The general foreman is an example of “the man in the middle”, subject to pressures from above and below. The film dramatizes his con.licting loyalties to the company and the men under him

results.title: The General Assembly
results.creator_credit: Krishna Singh, V.R. Sarma and United Nations Films
results.brief_description: Traces the history of the United Nations General Assembly and describes its efforts to promote human welfare and peace among the peoples of the world. Surveys the organisation of the General Assembly, areas of jurisdiction, and the work of committees. Includes scenes of an annual session as delegates and visitors arrive. Narrated by Michael Rennie.

results.title: Gene Deitch: picture book animated
results.creator_credit: Gene Deitch, Morton Schindel and Weston Woods Studios
results.brief_description: Picture book animator for Weston Woods Studios Gene Deitch, shares his insights into the purpose, art and technique of adapting, as animated films, outstanding picture books such as ‘Where the Wild Things Are’. Shows Deitch and his wife Zdenka, in Prague where they live and work.
